com.ac.games.rest.controller
Class BGGDataController

java.lang.Object
  com.ac.games.rest.controller.BGGDataController

@RestController
@RequestMapping(value="/external/bggdata")
public class BGGDataController
extends Object

This class should be the intercepter for REST service access to the BoardGameGeek game information.

It should handle all request that come in under the /external/bggdata entry.

Refer to the individual methods to determine the parameter lists.

Author:
ac010168

Method Detail

getBGGData

@RequestMapping(method=GET,
                produces="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
public Object getBGGData(@RequestParam(value="bggid",defaultValue="-1")
                                        long bggID,
                                        @RequestParam(value="name",defaultValue="null")
                                        String name,
                                        @RequestParam(value="review",defaultValue="null")
                                        String review,
                                        @RequestParam(value="source",defaultValue="bgg")
                                        String source,
                                        @RequestParam(value="batch",defaultValue="1")
                                        int batch,
                                        @RequestParam(value="sync",defaultValue="n")
                                        String sync,
                                        @RequestParam(value="filter",defaultValue="null")
                                        String filter)
GET method designed to handle retrieving the BoardGameGeek content from the BGG XML API and return the formatted BGGGame object.

This method supports the following parameters:

  • bggid=<gameid> - The gameID.
  • name=<game name> - The name of the game we want to search for
  • review=<<new|old|null>/code> - The fetch order for unreviewed content
  • source=<bgg|db|hybrid> - This indicated whether to request the game from BoardGameGeek (bgg) or from our cached database (db). Default is bgg.
  • batch=n - This indicates whether to generate a batch on game requests including bggID and up to 'n' additional sequential elements. Default is 1.
  • sync=<y|n> - Only useful on hybrid requests, once we build hybrid, automatically commit it back to database

Parameters:
bggID - The bggID that we are using to base this request on.
name - The game name that we want to search for wit this request
review - Indicated the order in which we want to process pending results
source - The source, either bgg or db we are requesting data from
batch - The number of rows to retrieve in batch from the server
sync - A flag indicating whether we should automatically post an update if we determine that newly read content has changed. This simplifies front-end workflow.
Returns:
A BGGGame object or SimpleErrorData message reporting the failure

putBGGData

@RequestMapping(method=PUT,
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8",
                produces="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
public Object putBGGData(@RequestParam(value="bggid")
                                        long bggID,
                                        @RequestParam(value="review",defaultValue="null")
                                        String review,
                                        @RequestParam(value="primarypub",defaultValue="null")
                                        String primaryPub,
                                        @RequestBody
                                        com.ac.games.data.BGGGame game)
PUT Method, which should update (or potentially upsert) the provided game object.

Parameters:
bggID - The bggID that we are updating. This element is required
review - The reviewFlag, corresponding the the Review State value
primaryPub - The primary publisher selected for this game. Required to create a new Game entry
game - The BGG Game content body we are updating.
Returns:
A SimpleMessageData or SimpleErrorData message indicating the operation status
